page.title: 19Local History Talk
page.content: In the 1870's Cwmfelinfach was still just a few farmhouses,sheep farms and workers' cottages.There was also a mill-Cwmfelinfach means "valley of the little mill." The main routeways followed the mountain summits.A tram road from Tredegar ran through the area built by the Sirhowy Co. On 26th.Dec.1829 the first steam train passed through the village.In 1850 the tramroad was converted to a railway by the Monmouthshire and Brecon Rail Co.From 1904-5 the colliery shaft was sunk and the village gradually grew as we know it. By 1921 all the streets we know now were built.The Pioneer Hotel,a local meeting place,was built in 1907,the school 1909,the Institute 1913.The oldest residence is the White House recently restored and on the Blackwood Chartists route to Newport.
